alert.note: Alert for Cape May; Cumberland (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 9:19PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cumberland and west central Cape May Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 919 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fortesque, or 13 miles southwest of Millville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Vineland, Millville, Laurel Lake, Newport, Mauricetown, Leesburg, Port Norris, Dividing Creek, Bricksboro, Port Elizabeth, Bivalve, Fortesque and Eldora. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
